thread.title: Green, Ennis lead Heat to preseason win over Atlanta
thread.title_full: Green, Ennis lead Heat to preseason win over Atlanta

title: Green, Ennis lead Heat to preseason win over Atlanta
text:
Green, Ennis each score 19 points in Miami's preseason win over Hawks By GEORGE HENRY Associated Press   9:31   9:32   
People: 
Georgia (561) 

ATLANTA — Gerald Green and James Ennis each scored 13 points and the Miami Heat beat the Atlanta Hawks 101-92 in a preseason game Sunday night. 
Chris Bosh had 14 points for Miami, which improved to 3-3 in preseason. Bosh and fellow starters Dwyane Wade and Luol Deng were held out in second half. 
Mike Scott finished with 19 points as Atlanta dropped to 4-1. 
HEAT: Center Hassan Whiteside was held out with a sore left ankle. Coach Erik Spoelstra said the injury isn't considered serious. Whiteside missed the first four preseason games with a strained right calf. ... The team listed "rehabilitative recovery" as the reason rookie forward Justise Winslow didn't play. ... F Udonis Haslem has stitches around both eyes and was held out. 
HAWKS: Coach Mike Budenholzer used his regular starting lineup of Kyle Korver, Jeff Teague, Al Horford, Kent Bazemore and Paul Millsap. All five began the third. 
UP NEXT: Miami hosts Washington on Wednesday. The Hawks host Memphis on Wednesday.
